meta.title: From BREVITY to WIT
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: Today's theme comes from Act II, Scene II of "Hamlet," in which Polonius remarks: "Therefore, since brevity is the soul of wit, / And tediousness the limbs and outward flourishes, / I will be brief: your noble son is mad."
